2cld Kerberos Install¶

References¶

  1. https://github.com/2cld/kerberos
  2. http://2cldkerberos.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
  3. https://github.com/floragunncom/kerberos_ldap_environment/blob/master/Vagrantfile

Install¶

This 2cld Kerberos install document is intented to educate and support the following:

  1. Manual command line.
  2. Vagrant based Virtual Box.
  3. Ansible based Provision Inventory.

Manual Setup¶

  1. Centos base image (with ssh) 2cldkrb5svr

  2. ssh root@2cldkrb5svr

  3. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# yum install krb5-server

  4. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# vi /etc/krb5.conf

    Uncomment lines that define realm and Search and Replace with your realm name:

    :%s/example.com/2cld.lan/
:%s/EXAMPLE.COM/2CLD.LAN/

    Point kdc and admin_server to kerberos-master:

    kdc   2cldkrb5svr.2cld.lan
admin_server = 2cldkrv5svr.2cld.lan
  5. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# vi /var/kerberos/krb6kdc/kdc.conf

    Search and Replace with your realm name:

    :%s/EXAMPLE.COM/2CLD.LAN/
  6. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# vi /var/kerberos/krb6kdc/kadm5.acl

    Search and Replace with your realm name:

    :%s/EXAMPLE.COM/2CLD.LAN/
  7. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# kdb5_util_create -s -r 2CLD.LAN

    INPUT KDC database master key: (THIS IS PASSWORD)

  8. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl enable kadmin

  9. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl enable krb5kdc

  10. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl start kadmin

  11. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl start krb5kdc

  12. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl status kadmin

  13. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# systemctl status krb5kdc

  14. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# firewall-cmd –get-services | grep kerberos –color

    Check if kerberos service is defined in firewall

  15. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# firewall-cmd –permanet –add-service kerberos

  16. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# kadmin.local

    This drops us into kadmin.local shell:

    kadmin.local:  addprinc root/admin_server
Enter password for principal root/admin@2CLD.LAN: (THIS IS PASSWORD FOR PRINCIPAL)

    Add 2 client test nodes ctnode1 and ctnode2, then create keytabs:

    kadmin.local:  addprinc -randkey host/ctnode1.2cld.lan
kadmin.local:  addprinc -randkey host/ctnode2.2cld.lan
kadmin.local:  ktadd -k /tmp/ctnode1.keytab host/ctnode1.2cld.lan
kadmin.local:  ktadd -k /tmp/ctnode2.keytab host/ctnode2.2cld.lan

    List principals:

    kadmin.local:  listprincs
(Confirm you see the new hosts)

    Quit out of shell:

    kadmin.local: quit

  17. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# scp /etc/krb5.conf /tmp/ctnode1.keytab ctnode1:/tmp/

  18. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# scp /etc/krb5.conf /tmp/ctnode2.keytab ctnode2:/tmp/

  19. [root@ctnode1 ~]# yum install pam_krb5 krb5_workstation

  20. [root@ctnode1 ~]# cp /tmp/krb5.conf /etc/

  21. [root@ctnode1 ~]# ktutil

    This drops us into ktutil shell:

    ktutil: rkt /tmp/ctnode1.keytab
ktutil: wkt /etc/krb5.keytab
ktutil: list
(should list the keytab)
ktutil: quit

  22. [root@ctnode2 ~]# yum install pam_krb5 krb5_workstation

  23. [root@ctnode2 ~]# cp /tmp/krb5.conf /etc/

  24. [root@ctnode2 ~]# ktutil

    This drops us into ktutil shell:

    ktutil: rkt /tmp/ctnode2.keytab
ktutil: wkt /etc/krb5.keytab
ktutil: list
(should list the keytab)
ktutil: quit

  25. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# yum install openldap-servers openldap-clients migrationtools

  26. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# cp /usr/share/openldap-servers/DB_CONFIG.example /var/lib/ldap/DB_CONFIG

  27. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# chown -R ldap. /var/lib/ldap/

  28. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# id ldap

    Should see the ldap user id gid and groups

  29. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# slapppasswd

    Should get a SSHA hash out, copy it

  30. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# cd /etc/openldap/slapd.d/cnconfig

  31. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# vi olcDatabase-{0}config.ldif

    Append the following to end of file:

    olcRootPW: {SSHA}longhashstringfromslappasswd
  32. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# vi olcDatabase-{2}hdb.ldif

    Change the following in file:

    :%s/my-domain/2cld/
:%s/com/lan/

    So should change following (and add olcRootPW, olcAccess to bottom:

    olcSuffix: dc=2cld,dc=lan
olcRootDN: cn Manager,dc-2cld, dc-lan
olcRootPW: {SSHA}longhashstringfromslappasswd
NOW AT END OF file
olcAccess: {0}to attrs=userPassword by self write by dn.base="cn=Manager,dc=2cld,dc=lan" write by anonymous auth by * none
olcAccess: {1}to * by dn.base="cn=Manager,dc=2cld,dc=lan" write by self write by * read
  33. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# vi olcDatabase-{1}monitor.ldif

    Change the following in file:

    :%s/my-domain/2cld/
:%s/com/lan/
    So should change following::

    … “cn Manager,dc 2cld,dc lan”

  34. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# systemctl enable slapd

  35. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# systemctl start slapd

  36. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# netstat -nltp

    Should see slapd service listen on port 389, LDAPS would run on 636

  37. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# firewall-cmd –get-services | grep lapd –color

    Check if lapd service is defined in firewall

  38. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# firewall-cmd –permanet –add-service lapd

  39. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# ls -l /etc/openldap/schema/

    Check for the schema names to import

  40. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# ldapadd -Y EXTERNAL -H ldapi:/// -f /etc/opneldap/schema/cosine.ldif

  41. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# ldapadd -Y EXTERNAL -H ldapi:/// -f /etc/opneldap/schema/nis.ldif

  42. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# ldapadd -Y EXTERNAL -H ldapi:/// -f /etc/opneldap/schema/inetorgperson.ldif

  43. [root@2cldkrb5svr cn-config]# cd

  44. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# vi base.ldif

    Insert the following:

    dn: dc=2cld,dc=lan
objectClass: dcObject
objectClass: organization
dc: 2cld
o : 2cld

dn: ou=People,dc=2cld,dc=lan
objectClass: organizatinalUnit
ou: People

dn: ou=Group,dc=2cld,dc=lan
objectClass: organizatinalUnit
ou: Group
  45. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# ldapadd -x -D cn=Manager,dc=2cld,dc=lan -W -F base.ldif

    Should ask for password

  46. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# ldapsearch -x -D cn=Manager,dc=2cld,dc=lan -W -b dc=2cld,dc=lan

    Should ask for password but then get search results.

  47. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# yum install

  48. [root@2cldkrb5svr ~]# yum install

  49. tbd
